thread.title: UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road
thread.title_full: UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road

title: UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road
text:
UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road Post to Facebook UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road   wcsh6.com: http://on.wcsh6.com/1LonHL0   Join the Conversation To   UMaine football rolls over Albany on the road Johnny Mehler, WLBZ 6:28 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 University of Maine Black Bear Football (NCAA FCS/Colonial Athletic Association) (Photo: WLBZ) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ALBANY, New York (NEWS CENTER) -- Playing a football game on the road is usually not a good thing but when it comes to the University of Maine and the University of Albany, the road team has come out on top in the last five match ups of the series. 
Maine started the scoring in the first quarter when junior quarterback Dan Collins hit junior wide receiver Jordan Dunn 13 yards for the touchdown to take a 7-0 lead. 
Collins took matters into his own hands on the next Black Bears touchdown when he called his own number for the one-yard score. 
The Black Bears started to run away with the game when sophomore running back Nigel Beckford got into the mix, scoring on a one-yard rush to make it 20-0. 
Maine dominated in total yards, 469-172, holding the Great Danes to a not-so-great seven points while picking up its first road win of the year, 39-7. 
Maine hosts Yale next Saturday afternoon at 3:30 PM at Alfond Stadium. Read or Share this story: http://on.wcsh6.com/1LonHL0 TOP VIDEOS
